fields.description:
The blogpost macro doesn't show blog from personal spaces when the username contains a '.' or '@'. E.g. my.name or my@name.com.

To recreate the issue.

1. Create a user with a username containing a '.'
2. Create a personal space for the new user
3. Add a blog post
4. Add a the BlogPost macro to the homepage of that space.
fields.summary: The blogpost macro doesn't show blog from personal spaces when the username contains a '.' or '@'

The editor in 4.2.2 (probably was introduced earlier but our company is just upgrading to 4.x) takes up an excessive amount of vertical space.  I'm calling this a bug since I think it’s a bad UX design and should have been thought through.

The title bar, toolbar and lower tool/info bar take up about 250 pixels combined.  On a screen where your browser leaves you with 875 vertical pixels of space, the controls for the editor are taking almost 30% of the usable region!!

The  title bar is especially excessive.  Its uses unnecessarily huge font text.  It should be made smaller so that more room can be left for editable region.

Some improvements / specific issues:
* Make the title bar a regular size one-line text region (no formatting)
* Once a table has been added to the document, the table controls in the toolbar are always displayed even if your cursor is not contextually inside of the table.
* The upper and lower toolbars have a lot of padding above and below the buttons.  This should be reduced to 1-2 pixels.
* The "Hint / Last Edited" bar should be made optional.  
** Ideally combine the last saved information to the lower toolbar (maybe just add a simple time in the "save" button such as "Save (8:14a)"
** Make the hint info completely optional
* Give user choice of having small toolbar buttons that take up less space
* Either give the user or the Space Admin option to customize the buttons that appear in the toolbar
* Move the lower toolbar into the upper toolbar and change the buttons to standard toolbar buttons w/o labels. 
** If you feel its needed you can still offer a pref to have toolbar buttons shown with text or not.  
** Some apps have a nice 3rd state which shows text on only the buttons which are really deserving of more than a simple icon.

The design of the editor as it stands now is form over function!!  I hope that the developers see to making changes to make this app more geared to getting work done efficiently instead of fussing over making sure the UI looks "pretty".  

Use case (to demonstrate how the current design impedes):
As it stands now, if I'm writing a spec and I paste an screenshot in that is 600 pixels high, I don't have any room to view the image and type about it.  All I need is about 10 lines below the image but now I'm forced to open a new window to preview the image while I type.

btw: I do like how some of the toolbar buttons where combined into multi-function to save space like having the 'insert' and different html controls under that.

From <confluence-url>/mail/archive/viewmailaccounts.action?key=<space-key>, you'll see only the following remarks instead of an existing space mail account:
{code}
No POP accounts have been configured for this space. (Add Mail Account)
{code}

However, the space email configuration exist in the database (BANDANA table). You can run the following query to double check:
{code}SELECT * FROM BANDANA where BANDANAKEY='atlassian.confluence.space.mailaccounts';{code}

Further digging on this issue, it seems that in 4.0.3, IMAPS configration is as follows:
{code}
<list>
<imapMailAccount>
<id>1</id>
<name>Test</name>
<description>Test IMAP</description>
<hostname>atlassian.com</hostname>
<username>test@atlassian.com</username>
<password>check</password>
<port>993</port>
<secure>true</secure>
<status>true</status>
<enabled>true</enabled>
</imapMailAccount>
</list>
{code}

I made a comparison by creating a new mail space account in 4.2.1 and the data stored in the database looks like this:
{code}
<list>
  <com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.ImapMailAccount>
    <id>1</id>
    <name>Test</name>
    <description>Test IMAP</description>
    <hostname>atlassian.com</hostname>
    <username>test@atlassian.com</username>
    <password>check</password>
    <port>993</port>
    <secure>true</secure>
    <status>false</status>
    <enabled>true</enabled>
  </com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.ImapMailAccount>
</list>
{code}

The obvious difference that I could see and compare is the following tag:
{code}
<com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.ImapMailAccount>
{code}

instead of 

{code}<imapMailAccount> {code}

h5. Workaround:
# Grab the bandanavalue from this query:
{code}
SELECT * FROM BANDANA where BANDANAKEY='atlassian.confluence.space.mailaccounts';
{code}
# Copy that value to a text file, and change *<imapMailAccount>* to *<com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.ImapMailAccount>*
# Insert it back into bandana with a query like this (replace the text between the ' characters with your own value from the step above:
{code}
update BANDANA set BANDANAVALUE='<list>
  <com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.ImapMailAccount>
    <id>1</id>
    <name>Test</name>
    <description>Test IMAP</description>
    <hostname>atlassian.com</hostname>
    <username>test@atlassian.com</username>
    <password>check</password>
    <port>993</port>
    <secure>true</secure>
    <status>true</status>
    <enabled>true</enabled>
  </com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.ImapMailAccount>
</list>'
where BANDANAKEY='atlassian.confluence.space.mailaccounts';{code}
# Restart Confluence
# The result is the space mail account is now visible and accessible from the page.

There are cases that shows Confluence synchronization were hanging and Confluence still think that the process is running fine. Without intervening (restart and database modification) this process, synchronization will not stop.

This result to multiple issue such as

* Confluence lock the database table as the directory is on synchronization process
* No new data being retrieved from LDAP and will continue like this if Confluence administrator does not check the synchronization process
* Resource locked in memory
* It is necessary to change the configuration using database *UPDATE* query on *shutdown* mode

By implementing a configurable maximum time of synchronization for example 2 hours or less, we could avoid all the above issue as Confluence will give "Synchronization Failed" message instead of keep it running in the background
